Frank takes a beat, contemplating the cigarette in his ha
What else, John.  It must be different, huh?  Are people living on the moon?
Didn't happen, we got enough problems down here.
What are we like in...1998?
(lying) We're okay...we're good, Dad.
(groping for good news) Hey, what about the Amazin's?  They pull it off?
You really wanna know?
Yeah, you betcha.

Well, game five was the big one.  It turned in the bottom of the 6th.  We were down 3-0.  Cleon Jones gets hit on the foot - left a scuff mark on the ball. Clendenon comes up.  The count goes to 2 2.  High fastball.  He nailed it.  Weis slammed a solo shot in the 7th to tie. Jones and Swoboda scored in the 8th.  We won, Pop.
Wow.
Julia walks into the study.
Hang on a sec, John.
(over the HAM) You there?
realizing something.
Jules, I want you to say hello to somebody... (re: radio) I'm on with John - that guy I told you about.
The future guy?
Yeah, but, no kidding around, he's a good guy, a real good guy...
Sensing that somehow this is important to her husband, Ju gives in, willing to play along with his radio game.  She shares Frank's chair, he puts his arm around her.
John, say hello to my wife...Julia.
H-hi.
Hey, future boy.  Frank tells me you're a cop?
Yeah, that's right.
Hearing voices, Johnny, Gordo and Elvis wander in from th family room.  They are in their pj's...a sleepover.  Juli gives them a smile, turns back to the radio.
My six year-old here keeps telling me he wants to be a policeman.  Right after he retires from the majors.  We just gave him a badge and a whistle for his birthday.
Yeah...I remember. (smiling) I used to play cops and robbers but y-- ...my mom wouldn't let me have a toy gun.
You're mom sounds like she's got some smarts.
She's pretty special.
Are you a good cop, John?
I try to be.
Then I'll bet she's real proud of you, huh?
Yeah.  I just wish I'd told her how proud I was of her.
I'm sorry.  I didn't realize... (beat) But she knew, John.  A mother knows what's in her son's heart.
Little Gordo reaches for the microphone.
I better go.  It's been good talking with you.
Julia scoops Johnny up, carrying him off to bed.  But lit Gordo does not follow...fascinated by the radio.
I wanna talk on the radio.
Frank laughs, as Gordo climbs up on his lab.
This is the Space Cowboy.  I'm an intergalactic traveler from the Federation planet earth.
Gordo?
How'd you know my name, mister?
John sits back, marvelling at how young Gordo sounds.  A thousand childhood memories playing in his head.  And the lights up...realizing the opportunity.
Hey, Gordo.  My name is Santa Clause. And I'm gonna give you the biggest Christmas present you ever had.
Gordo looks at Frank: is this for real?  Frank nods, smil
I better give you my address then.
Oh don't worry kid, I know where you live.  Now I want you to go upstairs and write this down, buy Yahoo. You got that Space Cowboy.  Y-a-h-o-o. It's a magic word and I never want you to forget it.
You got a deal, mister.  I mean Santa.
The sound of Julia's voice calling Gordo to bed.  Gordo scampers out.  Static filters through both radios, then..
John, you still there?
I'm right here, Dad.
You all right?
Yeah, I think so...
Don't worry, Chief.  I'm not gonna let anything happen to her...no matter what.

BZZZZ-SHHH.  A burst of loud static.  The band goes dead. John takes a beat to come down.  He gets up, making his w into the KITCHEN.  There's a half-full bottle of BUSHMILL the counter.  John reaches out to grab but the bottle.  B then he stops.  It is time to stop.  John turns on the fa and dumps the booze down the drain. The LEGEND reads: OCTOBER 15th - FOURTH GAME OF THE WORLD SERIES
a white vinyl DIARY with a blue heart shaped padlock held a hand.  A page is turned and the name ALAN SILVER comes clear.
an old Catholic High School yearbook on the dresser below diary and a PICTURE of DARYL ADAMS, 18 years old.
Can I keep these for a little while?
On SOPHIA FINELLI, 55, a profound sadness sits at her cor
Detectives' been through that stuff already back then.
John nods.  A beat.
You'll bring them back soon?
Promise.
John pulls a clear plastic BAG from his pocket with a pat of the partially disintegrated clothing found on Mary Finellis skeleton.
Do you know this?

Mrs. Finelli gasps in recognition, her eyes turning to a closet door. John opens the door to reveal MARY's CLOTHES, lined up in perfect order.  Visible among them is a "Candy Striper" uniform... a perfect match with the patch John holds.
Mary volunteered over at St. Vincents' after school.  She loved it...was going to become a doctor.
Silence.  Tears start to run down her cheeks.  John understands this woman's pain.  He looks around the room Mary's possessions.  Faded pictures.  Mary and her family Mary and her friends.
Her room...I just couldn't...it should only be her room...you know?
John does know.
I'm happy you found her, Detective.  It makes it easier...now, to know for sure. You know?
Silence again.  John nods.
John and Satch stand at the urinals.
Okay, lemme walk you through it.
Mind if I shake it off first...so's I can concentrate better.
John waits for Satch to finish.   Then, as they head out the hallway...
Three guys show up in both the yearbook and diary.

The first guy passed away ten years ago.  The second one in Vietnam. The room has a HOLDING PEN opposite the door.  A table is pushed up against the door wall and a more elaborate layo of the murder victims, paperwork, and calendar/timeline graphs sit on the table and are pinned on a cork board. Finelli's uniform is there. John shows Satch a photo in Mary Finelli's year book.
The third one is Daryl Adams.
Satch looks, nods, and steps back.  Waits for more.  John hands him Daryl Adams' rap sheet.
I ran him through BCI...got a hit. Busted for sexual assault: March 22, 1970.  Eight days after the last Nightingale murder.
So you figure the murders stop 'cause he's off the street.  Then by the time he gets paroled, he's smartened up enough to control himself?
Not the first time that's been true.  I'm telling you, I got a feeling about this guy.  This is the guy, Satch.
Uh, huh.
What?
I'm just trying to figure what interests me more: the possibility that Daryl is the guy, or you making him absolutely the guy.

SISSY CLARK steps off a BUS.  She crosses the street towa the club.  The bus moves out and WIPES FRAME, revealing F sitting at the intersection on his Harley. Sissy enters the club.  Frank guns the Harley into an all

Business is light at this hour.  The BARTENDER is setting The Flying Nun plays on a couple TV's over the bar - the audio drowned out by loud Motown music. Frank enters and looks around.  No Sissy.  This time he d not panic.  He sits at the bar.

the 47-year old face of Daryl Adams.  A notably unimposin guy.  He is not a happy camper. He is one of two PLUMBERS installing fixtures in the kitc of a new place.  Several other people are at work getting kitchen ready.  So as not to be overheard...
That was over thirty years ago.  I paid for that and then some.
You go to Xavier High School, Daryl?
Yeah.
You remember Mary Finelli?
(mentally steps back) What are you saying?
You know what I'm saying.
No, I don't.
Well, I think you do.

HAWAII FIVE-O plays on the TV's, the ROLLING STONES over Frank sits at the same place we last saw him, watching Si and scanning the crowd, trying to find a face that might him pause. Sissy, looking sixty and terrific in her Go-Go waitress outfit, moves about doing business.  She steps to the bartender t0 give her drink orders and pick up prepared drinks, coming within inches of Frank.
Give me a couple Bloodys, Gus, and a Dewars on the rocks.
She casts a friendly eye at Frank.
How ya doin' there?
Just fine.  You?
Right now, just fine.  Ask me later, fireman.
And she's off with the drinks.  He checks his watch.  It reads: 9:35PM.
A clock on the wall reads: 9:35PM The Nightingale murders display has been removed.  Daryl at the table in the middle of the room.  John sits opposi him.  Satch leans against the two-way mirror wall.
Sexual assault, Daryl.  Five years.  But you got lucky, right?  You got away with something else.  Something you figured nobody knows about.
What I know is what I told you.
Let me tell you what I know, Daryl.  You went to Saint Xavier with Mary.  You lived five blocks from her.  You liked her.  But she ain't interested.  That must've hurt, huh?
So what?
So, what'd you do about it, Daryl?
Nothing.
Satch can see this is going nowhere.

The 11 O'clock NEWS is on TV.  A "Super" shows the Mets w Game 4.  Score 2-1.  Mets lead series: 3-1. CREEDENCE CLEARWATER PLAYS out of the sound system. Sissy takes the order from a LONG HAIRED GUY  down the ba his back to the camera, and starts towards the cash regis area.  The bartender serves Frank another club soda.  As Frank drinks the bartender pulls a PACK OF CIGARETTES fro his shirt pocket.  But the pack is empty.
You spare a smoke?
I'm trying to quite.  Turns out those things'll kill you.
The bartender laughs, as Frank stands and heads for the bathroom.

A CLOCK reflected in the two-way mirror.  12:15PM. Satch stands drinking a cup of coffee behind the mirror. Before him, through the glass, sits Daryl Adams, with Joh pacing like a panther ready to spring. Suddenly, he slaps down crime scene homicide photos of several women in front of Daryl, who blanches...
Oh, my God!  What is that?!  Why you showing me this shit!?  JESUS!  JESUS! Get those away from me!
Nicky Moore.  Patty Ryan.  Mary Finelli. These names mean anything to you, asshole?  Julia Sullivan!  She mean anything?  She means something to me!
John looks like he's about to hit Daryl, but he glances towards the two-way mirror, controls himself.

Nilsson's EVERYBODY'S TALKIN' fills the air. A sexy WOMAN approaches Frank wearing an Emma Peel body s Sissy stands nearby, giving drink orders to the bartender she can't help but smile at the following.
You fight fires, honey?
Yep.  That's what I do.
I bet you do.
The bartender leans into the PA at the bar and announces.
Last call.
Frank flashes his wedding ring at the sexy woman.  Smiles her and shrugs "I'm sorry."

The clock reads 1:30AM. John sits at the end of the table, opposite Daryl.  His q masks the dark menace he is barely in control of.  Daryl stares at him like a deer caught in the headlights. Satch sets a Coke before Daryl and starts to leave the ro
I gotta take a leak. (to Daryl) You need to use the head?  You can, y'know.  If you want to.
Daryl shakes his head "no."

End of the night.  The place winds down.  An old movie on TV's.  Elvis' SUSPICIOUS MINDS plays softly. Frank watches as Sissy picks up her last tip and heads to back to change into her street clothes.
See you, Fireman.  Don't talk so much next time.
Frank smiles, checks the time.  2:00AM.  He looks around. Nobody suspicious about.  He starts up for the bathroom..
Satch enters with a fresh cup of coffee, settles back to watch.
With great ceremony John removes his watch, his gun, and lastly, his badge, and sets them off to one side.

You know, Daryl, sometimes, despite all the training we cops go through. Despite all that we are taught about right and wrong.  Despite all that we would like to honor in ourselves, we can come to a place where we don't give a fuck.  Know what I mean?
And John starts up from his seat and walks toward Daryl.
You are going to tell me what I need to know, Daryl.
SUDDENLY, in the door strides...
John.
John freezes.  Looks towards Satch.
Got a minute?
Yeah.  Sure.
Satch opens the door and steps out.  John collects his wa badge and gun and follows.
He ain't our guy, John.
Just cause he didn't want to look at the photos doesn't mean he isn't the doer. Not everyone fits the profile.
Long beat.
If he was gonna give something up he would'a done it already.
John pauses for several seconds, then nods slowly.

SUSPICIOUS MINDS filters in.  Frank zips up, heads to the sink.  Bends over to wash his hands, and suddenly. His face is smashed on the edge of the sink.  He twists t the floor, fighting to maintain consciousness. A black Frye boot explodes into Frank's gut.  He rolls ov looks up at the LONG HAIRED GUY from the bar.  Frank seem recognize him.  We know him too - SCRAGGLY MAN.  But we d know his name yet.  So we'll call him...
You following me?
Killer's eyes, evil fuckin' black dots.  He lifts Frank t his knees.  Then rips a fist into Frank's face.
I asked you a question, asshole.
Frank is clearly incapacitated.  Killer lifts him to his so they are eye-to-eye.
(barely able to speak) Mary Finelli...
A look of absolute shock wipes across the Killer's face.
Who the fuck are you?

Caught off guard, Frank is able to slam his knee into Killer's balls.  Killer goes down like a stone, but Frank too battered to take advantage. He collapses on top of Killer, who pushes him off, scramb up, and delivers a massive kick to his head.  Frank is ou cold. Quickly, Killer rolls Frank over and rifles his pockets finding his WALLET.  He grabs something from it, then tos it aside.  He then takes something out of his pocket, a t leather garrote.  He coils it around his hands and snaps taut.  He bends down to start the job when suddenly, the bathroom door opens and... TWO very stoned MEN stumble in.
Whoa, dude.  Is he okay?
Yeah.  He just needs a little time kissing the porcelain.

And Killer muscles Frank into a toilet stall and puts his head in the bowl.  He closes the door, quickly leaving. In the stall, Frank spills onto the floor, his legs stick out into the bathroom.  His face flush to the tile, his e trying to focus on something lying just outside the stall His WALLET.
John gets in his car.  Sits there, staring into the night
Frank starts to come around.  He reaches out and grabs hi wallet off the floor.  His money still there.  Credit car too.  But something's missing.  His DRIVER'S LICENSE. SUDDENLY PANIC SEIZES FRANK.
Frank tears up the stairs...
Frank bangs on it.  Scared.  Desperate.
OPEN UP, OPEN THE DOOR...ah...ummm...THIS IS THE POLICE.
Frank keeps banging on the door.  A NEIGHBOR'S DOOR swing open a crack.  AN OLD LADY peers out from behind a securi chain.  Frank stops banging.
It's okay, Ma'am.  I'm the police.

Old Lady skeptically looking him up & down - noticing Fra bruised face.  She quickly closes the door. Frank reaches inside his jacket pocket, pulls out a small bent metal wire, homemade LOCKPICK.  He goes to work on Sissy's lock.  CLICK, CLICK, CLICK - got it.  He opens th door, steps inside.

It's dark.  And then a sound...scratching and popping, th sound of a PHONOGRAPH NEEDLE makes when it reaches the en the vinyl and is scratching against the label. The wind catching a curtain allows the shaft of a street light to beam brightly into the room, and in one swift moment, Frank is staring at a NIGHTMARE: Sissy Clark's murdered body.  Her dress hiked above her waist.  Her pan ripped off.  Paper stuffed into her mouth. Her hands boun with glass tape.  Frank is transfixed and sickened by Sis twisted face, her eyes frozen open in horrible death.

Frank staggers out of the building towards his Harley.  H bends over and blows his dinner, then mounts the bike and kicks the motor over.  As he roars off down the street, W SEE in the building window... THE OLD LADY looking down at him. The LEGEND reads: OCTOBER 16th - FIFTH GAME OF THE WORLD SERIES
He killed her John.  He killed her and I didn't do a thing to stop it.
It's not your fault, Dad.
Yes it is...we did this.  We changed everything. (pausing) I've been having bad dreams, Johnny. Dreams where I die...in the fire. (soft) I was supposed to die in that warehouse.
No.
Frank.  Trembling, overcome by an awful combination of fe guilt and shame.
This is wrong...it's like we cheated...
I know... (beat) But Dad, you can't go back.  You didn't die in that fire.  And no matter what you do, nothing is gonna change that.  So all we can do is deal with this...and try to make it right.
I don't think I can.  I'm not a cop.  I can't.   I can't stop this guy.
But we can, we can do it together. Spirit and guts, remember?
Johnny, I know, but...
Frank starts to light up a Lucky.  But he stops, stubbing cigarette out.
I need you to believe in me.  To believe that we can do this.
John, he's got my driver's license.
What?
He took my driver's license, John, he knows where we live.
He took your wallet?
No, he tossed the wallet, but he kept the license.
He touched your wallet!  Where's your wallet?
In my pocket.
We got him!  Dad you got him!
What?
His prints.  You've got his prints.  I'll run them through criminal index.  You gotta get me that wallet.
How the hell am I gonna do that?
(thinks) Listen to me, very carefully, take your wallet out, just touch it on the corners.
What...
Please, Dad, just do it.
Okay, okay...
Frank does as John asks.  Taking out his wallet.
I got it.
Right, now I need you to tape it up on the outside, where he touched it, so the prints keep.
Huh?
Then you gotta hide it somewhere. Somewhere where nobody's gonna find it...for 29 years! (looking around the room) Put it under the loose floorboard by the window!
(getting it now) I gotcha, I gotcha Chief!
It's gonna work, Dad.  We're gonna stop him.
Hang on.

Frank fishes around the desk drawer for some electrical tape...quickly ripping off strips of tape...covering the wallet.  Then he goes to the window.  Crouches on the flo digging his nails around edges of the loose floorboard.
getting up.
(over the HAM) Okay.
John scrambles to window.  Crouches down on floor, reachi to find: FRANK'S WALLET COVERED IN ELECTRICAL TAPE! John goes back to the radio.
We're in business.  Just sit tight...and don't worry.
And John is up, grabs gun & shield.  Sprints for the door

head_text.subj: COMPUTER IS SEARCHING FOR A MATCH.

text: BINGO.  The right screen freezes.  A THUMB PRINT... A MAT Pull back to reveal John, standing over a forensic comput technician, HECTOR.  Hector hits a few more keys, a photograph pops on the screen - it is NOT DARYL ADAMS!
What the hell?
Hector hits another key, the man's name and photo pops up

HE'S 30 YEARS OLDER than when he tangled with Frank in th men's room last night, but this is the killer- Carl Shepa Below Shepard's photo, various biographical information: social security, address, current employment, and a New Y City Police Department Discharge - September 1973.
A strange look of recognition.
The old neighbor's son...the cop.  But he's dead.
What are you talkin' about?  I know this prick.  He worked outta Brooklyn North.
(realizing) He never died...
John exits his car to find Fred Shepard watering his plan
Just came by to wrap up over there. Thought I'd say "hello."
Glad you did.  Come on in.  Buy you a cup of coffee?
They enter the living room.  No Mrs. Shepard.  John's eye fix on the police academy graduation PHOTO of CARL SHEPAR His gaze then shifts to photos of Mrs. Shepard.
(beat) Wife around?
(a startled half-laugh) No.  No.  Well, sort of.  In my heart. Been dead 29 years.
Oh.  Sorry.  How so?
Well, she, Eve was murdered, Detective. An ugly one to tell you the truth.

John's breath catches.  His look shifts back to the photo Carl Shepard. Mr. Shepard reaches to open an album.  There are several photographs of the young Mrs. Shepard.  A couple where sh dressed in a NURSE'S UNIFORM. John is stunned.  One can only imagine what is now racing through his mind.
The mother of a cop, and they never found the bastard who did it.
Blown away, John looks out the window to where Mary Finel skeleton was found.
Happens that way sometimes. (beat) Son still on the job?
Nah.  Doin' P.I. work now.  Got caught up in them Knapp Hearings.  Set up by some dirty cops who needed a fall guy.  Hurt him bad.  Would've broken his mother's heart.
John can only stay inside himself and wonder at the madne of the world.

John walks past the lunchtime crowd, makes his way to the BAR.  Grabs a stool two...seats away from...Carl Shepard. John orders a soda, glances over at Shepard.  Their eyes meet.  John holds his gaze.  A slight nod...
You used to be on the job?
Yeah, long time ago.  I know you?
I look familiar?
(looking him over) No.  What house you work?
John gets up, slides next to Shepard.
The 2-3.  Homicide.
A hot shot, huh?
Nah, just working the job.
I hear that.
As a matter of fact, I caught a case that goes back to your day...one of the Nightingale murders.
Beat.
No kiddin'?
No.  Missing teenager.  Disappeared thirty years ago.  Found her bones last week.  Buried behind some old diner, up by Dyckman street.  Mary Finelli.
John waits again for Shepard's reaction...
Huh.

(sipping drink) Talk about dumb luck.  Odds of anybody finding that girl, thirty years later. And then the chances of hitting a dental...forget about it.  Bets part is she's the first victim.  She knew the doer.  I'm betting those bones are gonna do a lot of talking.
Shepard says nothing, but his eyes are burning into John.
The past is a funny thing.  We've all got skeletons in the closet.  You just never know when they're gonna pop up and bite you in the ass, Carl.
John slips something on the bar, next to Shepard.  It is crime scene photo of Shepard's murdered mother.  He reels back, totally losing his veil of composure.  He is freake
Who are you?
I'm the train wreck you didn't see coming.  And I'm gonna steal your life away.  You went down 30 years ago.  You just don't know it yet.
And with that, John gets up, leaving Shepard stunned.
Johnny and Gordo sit cross-legged in front of the TV.  TH WORLD SERIES is on.  Game 5.  First inning. Julia is busy bringing in groceries from her car. INTERCUT FRANK AND JOHN.
You're telling me this maniac is a cop? What the hell am I supposed to do with that one?
Call the FBI.  Use a pay phone.  Don't give 'em your name, Dad.  Just tell 'em that it was Shepard who killed Finelli and Clark and the others.  That he's the Nightingale.
In the B.G. of Frank's house a DOORBELL RINGS.  Julia can seen going to answer it.  It is Satch.  There are ad lib greetings that we don't clearly hear.
Tell them where Finelli's body is buried. They'll be able to connect him to her. Same high school.  Same class.  I'm betting they search his place they find some souvenirs.
Satch steps into the study...1969.
Okay, I'm on it. (sees Satch) Hey.
Hello, Frank.
Frank's hand lifts off the squawk bar.  He notes Satch's and demeanor.
What are you doing here, Satch?  You off today?
(over the HAM) Dad, you there?
Frank, we need to talk...
(into radio) John, hold on a second. (to Satch) I'm in the middle of something important here.  You mind if...

Frank suddenly spots something through the front window. Satch's partner, PHIL HAYES, and TWO UNIFORMS out at the curb. Half a penny drops.  All his senses go on alert.  And instinct kicks...he hits the squawk bar.
Satch, you gotta just give me...Satch is here John.  You hear me?  Satch is here.
I'm sorry, Frank, but you need to come outside.
Frank releases the squawk bar. Johnny and Gordo remain fixed on the game, oblivious to anything else.  In the kitchen, we can see Julia moving around putting away the groceries.
(over the HAM) Dad, what the hell is going on?
(into mic) Just a minute, John...okay?  Don't go away.

Julia now becomes aware of the tension in the voices in t other room.  She looks outside and sees Phil and the uniforms.  She looks at Frank and Satch with confusion. Frank hits the squawk bar again.  He wants John to hear t
What is going on here, Satch?  What are those guys doing out there?
I think you know, Frank.
No, I don't.
Let's go outside and talk.  We need to do that.
About what?
Let's go.  Do us both a favor.
A long beat.  Frank sees Julia staring at them.  She is n bundle of growing anxiety.  Frank stands up.
Okay. (to Julia) It's okay, Bud.  I'll be right back. (into radio) Stay there, John.
And then he and Satch walk out the front door.
...and towards a spot halfway between the house and the c From inside the house, Johnny and Gordo have begun to tak the activity.
Where were you last night, Frank?
The rest of the penny drops.  Frank stalls, trying to thi
What do you mean?
Do you know where I found this?
And he hands FRANK his missing DRIVER'S LICENSE.  Frank l like a truck hit him.
415 Greenwich St.  #302.  Under the body of a murdered woman.
No.  This isn't what you think.
I wanna be wrong here.  But we need to go to the precinct and talk about it.
Okay, okay.  I need to go say something to Julia and finish up with the guy on the radio.
You can talk to Julia.  Forget the radio.
Frank nods.  Takes stock of the cops by the cars and head back into the house.

Julia, who has been watching through a front room window Johnny, moves to meet Frank.  Behind Frank, Satch signals Phil and the uniforms that all is okay, giving Frank a co of steps on him. Frank steps into the house and wraps his arms around Juli turning so he can see both Satch outside and where he wan to go inside.
Trust me, Bud.  Do that for me.
Frank moves Julia toward teh desk, lulling Satch a moment then quickly steps to the HAM radio and hits the squawk b
John, you there?
(over the HAM) Yeah, Dad.  What the hell is going on?
Satch is busting me for Sissy Clark's murder.  John...
Julia stares dumbfounded at Frank.
Frank.
Satch strides by Julia and reaches to take Frank's elbow. Frank wheels at the sound of his name and the touch, and lurches back from Satch.
...you gotta help me, Chief.
-- and the movement yanks the mic cord to the radio tight dragging it to the edge of the desk. Johnny tears into the room and clutches onto his mother. "Daddy, Daddy!"
That's not the deal, Frank.  Don't do this to your family.
And Frank throws his hands up in front of his chest in an give up" gesture.
Dad!  Dad!  What's going on?  Satch?!
And the HAM radio CRASHES to the floor in 1969.
1998.  The HAM RADIO TRANSFORMING...a large dent appearin its casing before John's eyes...dials cracking. Dread creeps into John's face as we SMASH CUT TO:

We see what John sees in 1998.  But we also go inside his mind and glimpse flashes of new childhood memories.  Memo of seeing his father arrested for murder.  Images that ma JOHNNY'S POV from moments ago in 1969.

Frank sits at a metal table bolted to the floor, Satch si across.  Phil stands.  Two cups of coffee on the table. room is very bare.  Cinder block walls. Padded locks and bars over the windows.  A small metal cabinet against the far wall.  Satch and Phil smoke.  Fra does not.
Carl Shepard.  Detective out of the 15th precinct.
Satch stares at Frank with utter incredulity.  Phil light smoke, tossing the pack and the matchbook on the table.
I swear, Satch.
Uh, huh... (beat) Uh, huh.  And you got this from the guy you were talking to on the radio when I came in?
As nuts as that sounds, yes.
Uh, huh.
Satch, would you listen to me here.  Just you and me.  Can I talk to you here, alone?
Satch looks over at Phil.
Give me a little time with this guy.
Phil nods his understanding, steps out of the room.
Frank, this is not the time to be worried about covering up if you had a thing with this girl.
He's not gonna stop, Satch.  He's gonna keep on...

Are you listening to me?  You're in a world of shit.  An eye witness has you outside the dead girl's apartment.  We got your prints all over the place.  Plus the fucking driver's license, Frank. (beat) You gotta give me something here. Something I can believe.
It's quiet for a moment.  And then a sound filters in und the door.  The sound of cops cheering.  It's the World Series. Frank sits up - takes a beat.
What if I could prove it to you, Satch?
How's that?
What if I told you that in the bottom of the 6th we're gonna be down 3-0.  And Cleon Jones is gonna get hit in the foot. It's gonna leave a scuff mark on the ball.
Frank, please...
The next batter, Clendenon, hits one outta the park.
Frank, this is insane...
In the bottom of the 7th, Weis is gonna hit a solo home run.  Jones and Swoboda are gonna score in the 8th.  The Mets are gonna win 5-3. (beat) Go watch the game, Satch.
Go watch the game?  Go watch the fucking game?  Frank, they're gonna make you for Sissy Clark's murderer.  It matches the Nightingale's profile.  You understand what that means?
We hear the bolt slide, the knob turns and the door opens
His wife is here.  She wants to talk to you.
Satch nods okay to Phil.  He closes the door.
Whatta you want me to tell her?
Frank struggles for an answer...but comes up speechless. Satch looks like his heart is breaking.  Unable to compre how Frank could have slipped this far.  A long beat, then
She's in harm's way.  He's gonna be coming for her.
Satch snorts, incredulous.  Frank reaches over the table takes his hand, deadly serious.
Promise me, as a friend.  October 22, don't let her out of your sight.
Satch nods okay.  They have an understanding.
Satch walks down the stairs.  Julia alone on the bench. She sees Satch approaching, stands up, looking at him for answer, for an explanation...for hope.
(after a beat) Let's walk, get a cup of coffee.
Julia nods okay.  They exit the precinct house and into..
...the street.  Around the corner we catch sight of someo familiar - someone Julia and Satch don't recognize: Shepa
Shepard approaches the desk, flashes his shield at Sergea
You got a collar in here for the Nightingale murders?
Yeah.
I'm working with one of the victims outta Brooklyn North.  You mind I take a shot at him?
That's Deleon and Hayes' collar.
They around?
Just missed Deleon.  Hayes is up in the squad.
Where's the collar, in the cells?
No, I think he's up in interrogation.
I'll go find Hayes.
Shepard turns, gliding through the lobby like a shark...

Satch and Julia sit at a booth in the back.  Satch stirs coffee, trying to start a very hard conversation.  As he struggles to begin, the camera notices something in the B At the counter: a few stray people gathered around watchi the WORLD SERIES on an old TV. AUDIO COMES UP.

Shepard passes the COFFEE ROOM.  It is packed with detectives, gathered around a TV...watching the game.  Ph Hayes is among them.  And as Shepard passes, Phil half catches a glimpse of him as he glides down the hall and enters.
Frank looks up to see Shepard, who quickly closes the doo behind him... and unholsters his gun.  An eerie moment.
On your feet.
Frank waits a beat.  Then very slowly, he stands.
Now turn around, face the wall.

Frank steps back, slowly turning.  Shepard holsters the g Kicks Frank up against the wall as he reaches into his po and takes out the leather garrote we saw in the Peppermin Lounge Bathroom.  He coils it around his hands.
How did you know?
Frank is trembling.
(facing the wall) You twisted animal...
Evidence says you're the animal. (snapping garrote tight) That's why you hung yourself.
But Frank turns.
You try putting that thing around my neck and I'll rip your throat out.  You want me dead, use the gun.
Shepard smiles, unfazed...
Let me draw you a picture.  You live at 1060 41st Ave.  You have a wife who works at New York Hospital.  And a six-year old at P.S. 130.

Shepard gives Frank a look that would make a Marine Drill Sergeant shit his pants.  Shepard knows Frank's weakness, one thing that would make him submit to death. Closing his eyes, Frank turns to face the wall...But the handle rattles, someone is outside coming in.  Shepard quickly yanks Frank away from the wall, shoving him in a chair at the interrogation table. The door opens.
What the hell is going on here?
You got to help me.  He's trying to kill me.
Shepard just laughs.  Phil scans the room - everything lo normal, a cop questioning a perp.
Mind if we take it outside?
Phil shrugs okay.
(to Frank) I'll be right back.
Shepard and Phil step out - bolting the door behind them.
Shepard and Phil stand outside the door.
...didn't mean t step on your toes.  They sent me up from downstairs, I thought you'd be in there with him.
What are you looking at him for?

Frank's expression begins to harden.  His eyes search teh room.  CLOSE ON his EYES.  He looks like John - controlle rage piercing through that Sullivan thousand yard stare. He stands, turning around, looking for something, anythin that he can use to get the hell out of there. His mind's racing, fire fighter training kicking in.  And then he looks up - just below the ceiling, above the door 2'X2' ELECTRICAL CONDUCTOR BOX. Follow Frank's eyes to something else.  An AIR CONDITIONE MOUNTED IN THE WINDOW. Frank goes to the window.  Runs his fingers along the air conditioner's thick electrical cord - thinking.  He unplu it.  And then he RIPS cord out of the unit, exposing wire

A loud cheer rises out of the coffee room - the game is heating up.  Shepard and Phil are still standing outside interrogation room.  Shepard flashes a smile, having said something that makes Phil laugh...
Yeah, half the uniforms are either at the game or on the street.  It's gonna be a riot if they pull it off.
(glancing down the hall - in direction of sound of TV) What's the score?

Julia's crying.  Satch has no words to comfort her, now w of explaining any of this.  He reaches out across the table...taking her hand.  And as they sit quietly. CAMERA tracks towards the counter.  And we hear something that Satch does not.  The sound of a voice.  TV ANNOUNCER THE SERIES...
Cleon Jones thinks he's hit.  I think the ball hit him in the foot...
Frank uses the heel of his shoe to rip the plug off the o end of the electrical cord.  Both ends now have exposed wires.
Close on a MATCH.  Pull back to reveal Shepard lighting Phil's cigarette, then one for himself.  They are inside squad's coffee room now.  All eyes on the TV:
Hadges is coming outta the dug out.  He's calling for the ball.  Can we get a shot of the ball?
Shepard inhales deeply, sneaking a glance down hall at th closed interrogation room door.
Satch looks past Julia, distracted, curious.
Can you excuse me for a second?
Julia seems bewildered as Satch gets up out of the booth, making his way through the restaurant and towards the TV.

Frank, in full throttle, drags a chair against the wall. Climbs on the chair, uses a dime to unscrew the ELECTRICA CONDUCTOR BOX. He then unscrews the master fuse and SHOVES ONE END OF TH ELECTRICAL CORD'S EXPOSED WIRE AROUND THE FUSE CYLINDER. After re-tightening the fuse, and careful not to touch th other end of the cord, he jumps off the chair. FOOTSTEPS.  Frank freezes.  Someone's walking down the ha
Wall to wall cops.  Mesmerized by the game, especially Ph
There's a scuff mark on the ball!  The umpire has reversed his decision.  He's sending Jones to first base!
The cops erupt.  Cheering.
(yelling over the noise) You mind I go back at teh fire boy for a while?  I won't lay a hand on him, just want to see what he's got?
Go ahead, knock yourself out.
Shepard gives Phil one last smile, then slips out - casua heading down the hall...towards the interrogation room.

Frank, sweating bullets now, takes the two coffee cups of the table and pours their contents ON THE FLOOR.  The cof forms a SMALL PUDDLE which Frank is careful not to let sl over the door saddle. He puts the cups down.  Then opens the cabinet, rifling through, finding a can of LYSOL spray. Sounds of cops cheering filter in under the door.

Satch is riveted to the TV as Clendenon steps up to the plate.  Strike on. Satch jumps - Julia has come up behind him, touching him the shoulder.  She looks mad: how the hell can he be watc the ball game at a time like this?
What's going on, Satch?
Beat.
(dumbfounded) I don't know.
All eyes on the TV.  Another strike to Clendenon.  0-2 co

The door knob turns.  The door half-opens.  Shepard stick his head in, scanning the room.  He relaxes a bit when he sees Frank sitting quietly at the table. Shepard opens the door a little further, takes a half ste into the room...and into the puddle of coffee! Frank raises his arm.  He's holding the live electrical c Shepard: What the fuck?  Frank flicks the cord...which la like a snake at Shepard's feet...in the puddle of coffee. 5,000 volts surge through Shepard's body. SPARKS AND SMOKE SHOOT OUT OF CONDUCTOR BOX...

CLOSE ON TV.  Clendenon still up.  1-2 count.  The wind u But something is wrong with the TV.  A spark shoots out o the back of the set. And then the entire 17th Precinct goes DARK.  Frank has shorted out the electrical system. The cops look at each other in a moment of pissed confusi

Frank lunges over the table, smashing a wooden chair over Shepard's head.  He's in overdrive.  Kicking the still li cord out of the coffee puddle, he then drags Shepard's bo into the room, shutting the door. Frank quickly rips off Shepard's SPORTS JACKET, pocketing Shepard's WALLET and BADGE. And then, moving very fast, Frank grabs the LYSOL can and matches Phil left on the table.  He LIGHTS A MATCH and ho it IN FRONT OF THE LYSOL CAN.  He points the can at the ceiling - at the FIRE ALARM SENSORS.  Hits SPRAY button - Professional Fire Fighter ingenuity - HOMEADE BLOW TORCH.
FIRE ALARMS sound off.  SPRINKLER SYSTEM kicks in, water gushing from the ceiling.  Cops begin to move, investigat
Frank cracks open the door and slips out.  As the door closes, Shepard's eyes pop open.
Sprinklers rain down on Frank as he moves down the hall. Through the darkness he can see someone coming. It's Phil Frank covers his face...searching for a place to disappea

Nobody breathes.  All eyes on the TV. The count is now 2-2.  The pitch is a high fastball. Clendenon takes a massive swing.  He nails it.  HOME RUN! The coffee shop breaks into cheers.  Everyone screaming t heads off.  Everyone except Satch, who just stands there, complete and utter shock.  Julia looking at him questioningly.
(yelling over the madness) He was right!  Everything he said.  He was telling the truth.
Then you believe him?
Yeah I do.  You bet your life I do.

And they hug.  The weight of the world sliding off Julia' shoulders.  But someone is trying to get Satch's attentio It is the counter man, he's holding a phone. Satch takes the phone, beat, his face goes ashen.
I'm on my way...
He drops the phone, heading for the door.
(to Julia) Wait here, I'll send a uniform.
And Satch is gone.

Power is still off.  Sprinklers still gushing.  Amidst th chaos, a bathroom door swings open.  A man steps out.  A Leather jacket, gold shield.  It's Frank.  He slips throu the madness, heading down the hall and towards the stairs
Satch races down the crowded block...dodging celebrating Mets' fans...bolting up the precinct steps into the house
Phil runs in.  Scanning the room.  But it is empty.  No Frank.  No Shepard.  Just a puddle of coffee on the floor

Satch charges into the lobby.  The lights start to flicke back on.  Chaos giving way to order. Satch heads for the stairs. And there is Frank, wearing Shepard's jacket and shield. in his hurry, Satch has not spotted him. Frank quickly steps behind a pillar as Satch tears by him up the stairs. Stay with Frank as he turns...calmly walking by the Sergeant's desk, gliding out the precinct door and...
...disappearing into the street.
(little smile) Elvis has left the building.

John stalks down an apartment building hallway, gun drawn reaches a door.  Two locks and a bell.  Fuck 'em.  John smashes his bulk into the door...one...two...three times. bursts off its hinges.  John charges in. Place is empty.  Like somebody got the hell out in a hurr A few odds and ends left behind in the haste...including pile of unpaid bills.  CARL SHEPARD. John's eyes glaze over in rage and fury.  But then he see something that makes him stop and think.  There is a telephone on the floor, in a corner.  John stares at the phone, wheels spinning.  He reaches in his coat and takes his notebook.  Flipping through pages.  Notes on Shepard: social security, address, DMV registration, and a series phone numbers...home, office, cellular. John runs to the phone.  Punches in the cell number.  Rin
(over phone) Hell-
You have the right to remain silent.  If you give up that right...
Shepard is in his car, over a bridge, on the run...
Who the fuck is this?
Anything you say can and will be used against you in a court of law.
Sullivan?
You have the right to speak to an att --
Fuck you, asshole.
It's a small world, Carl.  And I'm gonna find you.  Real soon.

CLICK, CLICK -- dead bolt turning... Front door opens and SHEPARD WALKS IN.  His '69 apartment far nicer than the place we just left John in '98. Shepard runs to the bathroom.  Rips off the toilet's tank lid, reaches down and pulls out a .357 Magnum Colt Python wrapped in clear plastic. He rips off the plastic, shoves the pistol in his waistba heads into the kitchen. He gropes behind the refrigerator, close on an envelope g taped to back of the fridge.  Shepard's hand finds the envelope...he rips it loose.  And then he opens it - revealing its contents, souvenirs, POLAROID PHOTOS OF THE

head_text.subj: NIGHTINGALE MURDERS, WOMEN'S JEWELRY, NEWSPAPER CLIPPINGS

text: Shepard takes out a match to burn the photos.  But then.. The broom closet door bursts off its hinges.  Frank insta on top of Shepard.  The souvenirs go flying in the air. Frank pummels Shepard's head and back. But Shepard smashe his elbow in Frank's Adam's apple, lands a solid uppercut square on Frank's nose.  Frank's eyes watering up, VISION BLURRING.

Frank's hand, groping for the handle of a glass pitcher a the kitchen counter. Shepard reaches for his gun, points the .357 at Frank's h Shepard's finger squeezing the trigger. It's over.  But.. FRANK SMASHES THE GLASS PITCHER down on Shepard's skull. Shepard drops.  CRACK, the gun fires, BLASTING AIR. FRANK scrambles for the window.  He's outta there, expert thundering down fire escape.

Frank hits the pavement, twisting his ankle.  Hears metal rattling, looks up.  Shepard's clattering down after him. Shepard tries to get off a shot through the fire escape g BANG!  The shot ricochets wildly.  Frank takes off, limpi and staying close to the building out of the line of fire The streets are still empty, the city glued to their TV's Frank hits CPW.  He glances left, right, straight ahead. Central Park. Frank runs into the park.

The door is kicked open.  Satch and Phil enter, guns draw They take in the damage from the fight.  Following the tr of blood back to the kitchen. And there, strewn across th floor are Shepard's photos of his victims, the newspaper clippings, the jewelry, and the envelope with the glass t still on it. Satch knows.

Frank hears pounding footsteps - Shepard is catching up. Frank's adrenaline kicking in, sprints around a bend in t path, reaches long wooden bridge spanning Central Park La The bridge is being restored.  Barricades across the entrance. Frank hurdles over the barricades, runs onto the bridge. Shepard trips in the dirt.  Gets back up, reaches the bri knocks over a barricade, runs to the middle of the bridge FRANK'S DISAPPEARED.  Shepard stops, listens - nothing.
Frank dangles below the bridge, holding onto the steel gi of substructure - 8 ft. above water.  Not moving a muscle not making a sound, barely even breathing.
Crawling on Frank's arm.  Caught off guard, Frank flinche sending the rat tumbling.

Bridge side railings have been removed for construction. Shepard hears something hit the water.  Rushes to the sid the bridge, points his gun at the water.  BANG! Shepard leans out further aiming the gun at the water. Shepard's outstretched arm only a few feet from Frank's h Frank silently swings his body forward reaching out... Snags Shepard's arm, pulling him hard, over the side. SHEPARD FALLS, grabs for something, anything.  Wraps his around Frank's leg, hangs on tight. Frank struggles, kicks wildly, trying to shake Shepard of Shepard hangs on with his left arm.  Pulls out the gun wi his right.  He aims it at Frank's head.  Cocks back the hammer. FRANK LETS GO.  KERPLUNK.  They plunge into:

Murky water, thick with dirt and slime, 5' deep. Frank's hanging on to Shepard's arm, trying to wrestle th gun free.  But Shepard's using his free hand to gouge Fra eyes.  Frank bites down hard on Shepard's wrist. The gun sinks silently to the muddy lake bottom. But Shepard gets both hands on Frank's throat.  Shoving h head into the shallow water.  Shepard's grip is like a vi Frank futilely tries to pry Shepard's fingers open. Frank is blinded by polluted water.  Starting to lose consciousness.  Desperately, he searches the muddy lake bottom for the gun.  But he's getting weaker, fading out. Then he feels something.  A BRICK, fallen off the bridge, half buried in the mud.  Frank struggles to dig it up. Summons his last ounces of strength, yanking it back and forth, it's getting loose. But Shepard's hands are squeezing tighter.  Frank finally goes limp.  A few last bubbles float to the surface.  She smiles.  Catching his breath, slightly loosens grip on Frank's lifeless neck. Frank springs off the lake bottom, rises out of the water like a jack-in-the-box.  Holding the brick with both hand he swings.  CONTACT. The brick smashes against Shepard's head.  Knocking him t yesterday.  He drops like a rock. Frank waits for Shepard to come up for air.  Nothing. Frank crawls out of the water, collapsing onto the embankment.  He just lies there, heart pounding, chest heaving. And suddenly, Frank is startled by a MASSIVE ROAR - the s of eight million New Yorkers screaming in unison.  The Me have just won the World Series. Frank laughs, slowly getting to his feet.

Frank's dripping blood and filthy lake water.  The street have instantly erupted with celebrating Mets' fans.  A gi party.  Cars whiz by, honking their horns, passengers lea out, pumping fists in victory.  Frank has to yell above t racket.
(over phone) 17th Precinct.
Detective Deleon.
(over phone) Hold on.
The Nightingale evidence from Shepard's kitchen floor is spread all over the squad room.
Deleon.
Satch, you gotta listen to me...
Frank.  We know.  We know it's Shepard.
No kidding.  I'm on the corner of 65th and CPW.  Come get me.
Frank clicks down the receiver, slides in a dime, dials another number.  A beat, then...
(over phone) Hello?
Frank smiles, and we dissolve to

The area cordoned off.  Detectives and uniforms.  EMS wag An inflatable boat is being placed in the lake.  Two poli frog men are climbing into their gear. Pan over the scene to find Frank and Satch.  Frank's got blanket wrapped around him.  They talk quietly as Satch w Frank to a waiting green and white squad car.
You missed a hell of a game, Frank.
Next time lets put some money on it.
(to the uniform driver) Get him home safe.

Satch sticks out his hand...Frank takes it.  They hold ea other's grip for some moments.  Frank starts to say "than you", but Satch silently cuts him off. Frank climbs in the car.  Satch closes the door, taps on roof, Frank is on his way home.

JOHNNY is asleep in bed.  Elvis sleeps at the foot of it. the shadows next to them, Julia sits very still in a rock chair, half-asleep, half-awake.  Staring out the window. eyes are bloodshot.  She has been through hell. A faint STAIRWAY CREAK.  Elvis stirs.  He looks up to SEE FRANK standing in the doorway.  He looks a wreck.
Hey, bud.
Frank...
And she is out of the chair.  They meet in a hug.  Over h shoulder Frank takes a long look at his sleeping son.

Relatively cleaned up, but very bruised, Frank is at the desk, trying to repair the DISASSMBLED RADIO.  Julia come and sets down a cup of coffee.  She kisses him on the top his head, casts a wondering eye on the radio, and leaves.

John pulls into the driveway and stops.  He stares out th window, exhausted.  And then something catches his attent A SOUND.  Coming from inside the house.  The HAM RADIO? He bolts from the car, runs to the door, scrambles to get backdoor key into the lock, as --
(over the HAM) John, John?  You there?  Johnny?
John barrels into the kitchen, leaving door ajar, and run
John hits the squawk bar on the HAM which...
I'm here, Dad.  I'm here.
We did it, John.  We stopped him.
A short pause, John looks confused.  He sits down.
Wait.  Something's wrong.  I don't...
What's wrong?
I don't remember.  Why don't I remember?
WHACK!  CLOSE ON FRANK, the back of his skull smashed by butt of a .45 wielded by CARL SHEPARD. FRANK hits the floor with a thud, Shepard looming over hi reaching for a set of handcuffs.
Dad?  Dad?  What's...
WHACK!  The butt of a .45 smashes the back of JOHN's skul He tumbles to the floor...fighting to stay conscious. CARL SHEPARD stands over him, the gun pointing at his hea
My turn to steal your life.
Shepard stands over Frank.  Frank tires to struggle up. Shepard forces him back down, tromping a boot into his ch
You're a clever fuck, fireboy.

And he snaps a handcuff on one of Frank's wrists then wrenches him to a steel radiator in the family room where circles the pipe to the floor with the handcuff chain and attaches the other cuff to Frank's other wrist.

John is woozy.  He reaches down to his holster - it is em Shepard has got John's 9mm in his left hand.  Holding the to John's head, Shepard pops the clip out of the 9mm and tosses it aside.  He then snaps a handcuff around John's wrist, begins dragging him to the radiator. John's FOOT ERUPTS up into Shepard's groin.  The .45 goes flying across the room.  For a suspended moment, both men riveted to the .45 spinning on the floor.

Frank, struggling to breathe, is slumped by the radiator staring up at Shepard's groin.  The .45 goes flying acros the room.  For a suspended moment, both men are riveted t the .45 spinning on the floor.
Frank, struggling to breathe, is slumped by the radiator staring up at Shepard, who is staring back with pure mena The SOUND OF A SHOWER can be heard upstairs.  Shepard loo up.  Smiles.
Time to meet the family.
(struggling to breathe) This is between you and me.
Not any more.
Julia luxuriates in a steaming shower.  Singing, softly.
A BRUTAL STRUGGLE FOR THE GUN between John and Shepard.
Frank desperately tugs at the handcuffs.  Steel bites dow his wrists.
Julia smiles as she sees a figure through the curtain.
Hey, Bud.  Want to join me?
And the shower curtain flies open to reveal SHEPARD.
Sure do.
Julia lets out a bloodcurling scream and plasters herself against the shower wall.
Frank reacts to the scream and tears with everything he h in him to rip away from the radiator.  No way.
Johnny stirs awake at the sound of the scream...

John and Shepard are in a desperate TUG OF WAR over the g They KICK viciously at each other.  Butting heads.  But J is still woozy from the head wound and Shepard is still v strong.  BANG!  The gun goes off.
Julia is paralyzed against the wall.  Staring into the de as-marble eyes of Shepard.  He looks her up and down.
Nice.

Frank's wrists are bleeding.  He can't get out.  But then sees something.  Something he can use.  His WATCH.  Frank struggles to unfasten the watch strap.  He does it.  He pinches the metal clasp with his thumb and forefinger and guides it to the keyhole in the left handcuff.  He works Nothing.  Then CLICK.  He's out!
John Shepard fight furiously.  But John has managed to ge control of the .45's TRIGGER.  He squeezes it.  BANG.
Shepard's hands are moving towards Julia's breasts.  SUDD she lashes out, DIGGING HER NAILS DEEP INTO SHEPARD'S FACE...TEARING FLESH, DRAWING BLOOD.
CLOSE ON SHEPARD, struggling with John.  A LARGE SCAR ETC ONTO HIS FACE, in the exact spot where Julia dug her nail 29-years ago.  BANG!!  BANG!!
Shepard grabs Julia by the throat.  Slams her against the wall, knocking her unconscious onto the shower floor.  He touches the GASH on his face, stares at the blood.
BANG!  BANG!  John keeps squeezing that trigger. CLICK.  CLICK.  No more bullets. Shepard lets go of the gun, heave John over and grabs him the neck...strangling him.

Shepard is on top of Julia in the shower.  He uncoils the garrote, snaps it taut, and starts around her neck. And then a SOUND.  Instantly recognizable.  Beyond adequa description.  But once you've heard it, you don't forget it...
Shepard's head spins about.
Get your fucking hands off my wife.
Don't.  Don't do it, Frank.  You're not a killer.

He is right.  Frank hesitates.  Shepard LUNGES, grabbing shotgun barrel. BOOM!  Frank FIRES.  BUCKSHOT RIPS THROUGH THE AIR. SHEPARD'S RIGHT HAND EXPLODES...blood spattering everywhe Like a wounded animal, Shepard bolts, blowing past Frank. Frank gently wraps Julia in a towel.  The fading sound of Shepard thundering down the stairs.  Out the door. And then softer footsteps.  Coming closer.  Johnny appear the doorway.  Safe and sound.

head_text.subj: SHEPARD RIGHT HAND GOES LIMP AROUND JOHN'S NECK. HE STAR
IN SHOCK AS HIS HAND BEGINS TO DISFIGURE.

text: John starts to choke back to life... And then something happens.  Some kind of SHOCK-WAVE ripp through the house -- bending light - bizarrely distorting everything in its path, including Shepard and John. The shock-wave is over.  But the house is different. Changed. Shepard scans the changed room - disoriented, bewildered. CRASH!  John pounces.  Pounding blows to Shepard's head. John is on top of Shepard, hands on his neck.  As John squeezes the life out of him, Shepard struggles to reach his leg with his good hand... There's something down there.  An ankle holster.  Shepard strains to get his hand on the gun.  He does. In a flash, Shepard has the gun to John's temple. CLICK.  Shepard cocks back the hammer.
You were the kid.  I remember now.
Keeping the gun pressed against John's temple, Shepard ge to his feet.
But this time, no Daddy.
John closes his eyes.  It's over, he knows he's gonna die SILENCE.  Then a sound.  A sound we've heard before.  A s you never forget.  Music to our ears.

head_text.subj: SHOTGUN RATCHETING A ROUND IN THE CHAMBER.

text: Shepard looks up to see: MAN HOLDING SHOTGUN. B-O-O-O-M: SHOTGUN BLAST:  Buckshot ripping into Shepard. Impact lifting him off his feet.  He lands dead on the fl
Opening his eyes.  Looking up at the doorway.  Blinking through shotgun smoke, trying to focus.  Not believing wh he sees.
John looks up at his father, speechless.
I'm still here, Chief.

We are soaring high above a baseball diamond.  Clear ligh air, you can see for miles.  Float down to the field... The first taste of Spring and Softball.  Picnic baskets. Flowers.  Kites flying.  Children running. The bleachers filled with families and loved ones. Among them sits SAMANTHA.  She's smiling, she's glowing...she's pregnant.  PULL BACK to reveal SATCH, GOR ELLEN & GORDY JR.  A dalmation puppy scampers at their fe barking in recognition as... Frank Sullivan steps into the batter's box.

Pitcher: 22 year-old African-Amerasian, a muscular beanpo Embroidered on the back of the his FDNY jersey is his nickname: PHIRE POWER. Quick shot of first baseman.  GRAHAM GIBSON - once a nerv PROBIE, now a seasoned vet.  And one hell of proud father
(to pitcher) Take it easy on him son, he's older than Moses.

Frank sneers at Gib, then glances up at GIB's WIFE in the bleachers.  She looks familiar, it's the girl Frank saved the warehouse 29-years ago. PHIRE POWER twirls his arm... Frank takes a big swing...contact...the ball fouls back behind the plate.  Towards the parking lot.  Where among old Chevys and Fords sits a brand new MERCEDES.  The cust license plate reads: YAHOO. CRASH!  Frank's foul ball comes down hard.  As the Merced windshield spiderwebs we hear an off-camera scream... It is Gordo, jumping up, running across the field.  From parking lot his eyes meet Frank's.  An I'M SORRY shrug, a Frank turns his attention back to the game. The next pitch is high and outside. Frank takes a looping swing...driving the ball to the gap right center.  Frank jogs to first.  An easy single. From first, Frank glances over at the third base coach: JULIA.  Her hair pinned up under a Mets cap, Julia puts t fingers in her mouth and belts out a loud whistle as... The next batter steps out of the dugout.  It is John Sullivan.
John as he makes his way to the plate. Check out his eyes: they're different, he looks like his father.  They've got that Frank Sullivan sparkle. John steps into the batter's box, cocks back to wood.
Bring me home, son!  Bring me home!

PHIRE POWER uncorks the fastest softball pitch you've eve seen.  John jumps on it.  Rips a massive shot to deep cen way over the fence. The crew in the stands are on their feet, cheering. Frank rounds third, John catches up.  A double high-five Julia and they jog home together.  The game is over. Frank puts his arm around John.  Heading for the bleacher A little boy totters up to them.  Jumping into John's arm His name is Frank Jr.
Hey there, Chief.

John gives his son a kiss, glances up at Samantha in the bleachers.   They share a smile.  And as they step off th field, his little boy reaches up, takes John's hat off hi head and puts it on his own...
Elvis has left the building...
John's face.  In his eyes, bliss. CUE Bruce Springsteen's: TAKE ME OUT TO THE BALLGAME.

Archival film footage.  1969 World Series.  Game Five.  T last pitch.  Mets win.  Shea stadium erupts.  Fans stream onto the field.  Lifting the players on their heads. The madness continues for a while, then slowly fade to Fi Ave.  Mets' ticker tape parade.  It's a hell of a party.
